Head of the research unit "Avian and Rabbit Welfare and Epidemiology" One of the main research topic is the study of the impact of housing and husbandry practices on poultry welfare and health and on food quality. 3 species are mainly studied: chicken and turkey: with the assessment of welfare of broiler and breeders (main topic: activity of animals, assessment of lesion (FPD) in slaughter house and animal health) laying hens: study of different housing systems (aviaries, furnished cages on welfare, health and egg quality) other topics: poultry health (histomonosis, Avian Influenza, Botulism,...); food safety (Salmonella, campylobacter,...), air quality in poultry houses, epidemiological surveillance networks, collecting and analysing information about avian rearing conditions and diseases. reasearch is done one experimental station and in farms one the field (chicken, turkey, laying hen, duck,...) See papers on: chicken welfare assessment (scoring system and impact of housing and management conditions on chicken welfare and health); laying hens welfare; food safety;...
